#Text=Monitor Internet Speed over Time on PC or Mac
#Text=This wikiHow teaches you how to monitor your internet speed over time on both PC and a Mac using TestMy.net or Speedcheck .
#Text=Both of these tools will let you test your internet bandwidth for free and will work for both Mac and PC users .
#Text=Using one of these websites , you 'll be able to monitor changes to your internet speed over minutes , hours , or days , so you can keep up to date on how well your internet is performing .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Using TestMy.net to Monitor Internet Speed
#Text=Navigate to the TestMy website .
#Text=You should be on the automatic speed test page .
#Text=If you are on the homepage just click on the AutoTest text on at the top of the page .
#Text=Click on the circle next to .
#Text=This will test your upload and download internet speed .
#Text=You can test just your upload or download speed by clicking one instead .
#Text=Select how long you want to test your internet by clicking on .
#Text=For example , you can set it to check your internet speed every 30 minutes .
#Text=If you set the time to less than 10 minutes
#Text=the site will ask you to sign up .
#Text=Make sure pop-ups are not blocked or the test will be unable to refresh .
#Text=Select how often you want the test to repeat by clicking on .
#Text=For instance , you can set it to repeat 5 times a day .
#Text=Click on the button to begin testing your speed .
#Text=You can still browse normally on a different tab if you ’d like or you can minimize the window and come back .
#Text=Your information is not automatically saved unless you create an account .
#Text=For longer tests , you cannot turn off your computer even if you create an account .
#Text=If you plan on doing a test longer than a day it is recommended that you create an account in case of disconnection issues .
#Text=You can end the test early at any time by clicking the button at the top .
#Text=Click on the button to see how your internet speed changed .
#Text=The graph will average out your speed and display changes over time .
#Text=Testing Internet Speed Manually with Speedcheck
#Text=Visit the Speedcheck website .
#Text=The homepage is where you can begin the test .
#Text=Decide how long and how often you want to test your net .
#Text=You will need to check back in and run tests manually .
#Text=You 'll also need to leave your computer on or you can create an account to save your tests .
#Text=Create an account by clicking and then in the top-right corner of the page .
#Text=Click to begin your internet speed test .
#Text=Your data will be saved in your browser so leave your computer on while the tests run .
#Text=If you created an account you can start the test and turn off your computer after it finishes .
#Text=Check your results by clicking the tab .
#Text=It will be located at the top-right corner of the page .
#Text=Run several tests throughout the day to calculate the average speed .
#Text=Go back to the tab whenever you want to begin another test .
#Text=Having several tests throughout the day will show a better internet speed average under “ History ” .
#Text=If you wanted to test your speed over the week just run the test a few times each day over the week .
#Text=In this case , creating an account would be best so you can save your results if the computer shuts off unexpectedly .
#Text=Quick Summary
